intro: Ballota nigra subsp. nigra, commonly known as black ballota, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Leguminosae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in Mediterranean climates. It produces small, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to purple. The subspecies is distinguished by its dark, almost black seeds and its adaptability to arid environments.
